propdef-align-content.name: flex_context
propdef-align-content.summary: The CSS align-content property sets the distribution of space between and around content items along a flexbox's cross-axis or a grid's block axis.
propdef-align-content.title: align-content

propdef-align-content.name: grid_context
propdef-align-content.summary: The CSS align-content property sets the distribution of space between and around content items along a flexbox's cross-axis or a grid's block axis.
propdef-align-content.title: align-content

propdef-align-items.name: flex_context
propdef-align-items.summary: The CSS align-items property sets the align-self value on all direct children as a group.

chrome.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

chrome_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

firefox.notes: Multi-line flexbox has been supported since Firefox 28.

firefox_android.notes: Multi-line flexbox has been supported since Firefox 28.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 10 and 11, if column flex items have align-items: center; set on them and their content is too large, then they will overflow the bounds of their container. See Flexbug #2.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Samsung Internet 6.0.

webview_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

edge_blink.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

propdef-align-items.title: align-items

propdef-align-items.name: grid_context
propdef-align-items.summary: The CSS align-items property sets the align-self value on all direct children as a group.
propdef-align-items.title: align-items

propdef-align-self.name: flex_context
propdef-align-self.summary: The align-self CSS property overrides a grid or flex item's align-items value. In Grid, it aligns the item inside the grid area. In Flexbox, it aligns the item on the cross axis.

chrome.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

chrome_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 27, only single-line flexbox is supported.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox 27, only single-line flexbox is supported.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Samsung Internet 6.0.

webview_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

edge_blink.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

propdef-align-self.title: align-self

propdef-align-self.name: grid_context
propdef-align-self.summary: The align-self CSS property overrides a grid or flex item's align-items value. In Grid, it aligns the item inside the grid area. In Flexbox, it aligns the item on the cross axis.

ie.notes: Internet Explorer 10 and 11 have the property -ms-grid-row-align, which acts in a similar way to align-self.

propdef-align-self.title: align-self

column-row-gap.name: flex_context
column-row-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.
column-row-gap.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

column-row-gap.name: grid_context
column-row-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.
column-row-gap.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

column-row-gap.name: multicol_context
column-row-gap.summary: The column-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's columns.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 3, the default value for the normal keyword was 0 and not 1em.

column-row-gap.title: column-gap (grid-column-gap)

propdef-gap.name: flex_context
propdef-gap.summary: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.
propdef-gap.title: gap (grid-gap)

propdef-gap.name: grid_context
propdef-gap.summary: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.
propdef-gap.title: gap (grid-gap)

propdef-gap.name: multicol_context
propdef-gap.summary: The gap CSS property sets the gaps (gutters) between rows and columns. It is a shorthand for row-gap and column-gap.
propdef-gap.title: gap (grid-gap)

propdef-justify-content.name: flex_context
propdef-justify-content.summary: The CSS justify-content property defines how the browser distributes space between and around content items along the main-axis of a flex container, and the inline axis of a grid container.

chrome.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

chrome_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 27, Firefox supported only single-line flexbox.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox 27, Firefox supported only single-line flexbox.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

webview_android.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

edge_blink.notes: Older versions of the specification treat absolute positioned children as though they are a 0 by 0 flex item. Later specification versions take the children out of the flow and set their positions based on align and justify properties. Chrome implements the new behavior beginning with Chrome 52.

propdef-justify-content.title: justify-content

propdef-justify-content.name: grid_context
propdef-justify-content.summary: The CSS justify-content property defines how the browser distributes space between and around content items along the main-axis of a flex container, and the inline axis of a grid container.
propdef-justify-content.title: justify-content

propdef-justify-items.name: flex_context
propdef-justify-items.summary: The CSS justify-items property defines the default justify-self for all items of the box, giving them all a default way of justifying each box along the appropriate axis.
propdef-justify-items.title: justify-items

propdef-justify-items.name: grid_context
propdef-justify-items.summary: The CSS justify-items property defines the default justify-self for all items of the box, giving them all a default way of justifying each box along the appropriate axis.
propdef-justify-items.title: justify-items

propdef-justify-self.name: flex_context
propdef-justify-self.summary: The CSS justify-self property sets the way a box is justified inside its alignment container along the appropriate axis.
propdef-justify-self.title: justify-self

propdef-justify-self.name: grid_context
propdef-justify-self.summary: The CSS justify-self property sets the way a box is justified inside its alignment container along the appropriate axis.

ie.notes: Internet Explorer 10 and 11 have the property -ms-grid-column-align, which acts in a similar way to justify-self.

propdef-justify-self.title: justify-self

propdef-place-content.name: flex_context
propdef-place-content.summary: The place-content CSS shorthand property allows you to align content along both the block and inline directions at once (i.e. the align-content and justify-content properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox.

firefox.notes: Starting with version 60, you can only specify a single value if it is valid for both align-content and justify-content.

firefox_android.notes: Starting with version 60, you can only specify a single value if it is valid for both align-content and justify-content.

propdef-place-content.title: place-content

propdef-place-content.name: grid_context
propdef-place-content.summary: The place-content CSS shorthand property allows you to align content along both the block and inline directions at once (i.e. the align-content and justify-content properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox.

firefox.notes: Starting with version 60, you can only specify a single value if it is valid for both align-content and justify-content.

firefox_android.notes: Starting with version 60, you can only specify a single value if it is valid for both align-content and justify-content.

propdef-place-content.title: place-content

place-items-property.name: flex_context
place-items-property.summary: The CSS place-items shorthand property allows you to align items along both the block and inline directions at once (i.e. the align-items and justify-items properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox. If the second value is not set, the first value is also used for it.
place-items-property.title: place-items

place-items-property.name: grid_context
place-items-property.summary: The CSS place-items shorthand property allows you to align items along both the block and inline directions at once (i.e. the align-items and justify-items properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox. If the second value is not set, the first value is also used for it.
place-items-property.title: place-items

place-self-property.name: flex_context
place-self-property.summary: The place-self CSS shorthand property allows you to align an individual item in both the block and inline directions at once (i.e. the align-self and justify-self properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox. If the second value is not present, the first value is also used for it.
place-self-property.title: place-self

place-self-property.name: grid_context
place-self-property.summary: The place-self CSS shorthand property allows you to align an individual item in both the block and inline directions at once (i.e. the align-self and justify-self properties) in a relevant layout system such as Grid or Flexbox. If the second value is not present, the first value is also used for it.
place-self-property.title: place-self

propdef-row-gap.name: flex_context
propdef-row-gap.summary: The row-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's grid rows.
propdef-row-gap.title: row-gap (grid-row-gap)

propdef-row-gap.name: grid_context
propdef-row-gap.summary: The row-gap CSS property sets the size of the gap (gutter) between an element's grid rows.
propdef-row-gap.title: row-gap (grid-row-gap)
